questions.text: My spiritual strength to help others without being pulled down is ...
questions.principle: Spiritual surplus enables ministry to others

answers.4: solid — I can usually help without losing ground
answers.5: strong — I have reserves to pour out without depleting myself
answers.2: weak — helping others often destabilizes me
answers.3: moderate — I can help sometimes, but it costs me
answers.1: absent — I get pulled down easily

answers.5: robust — I've built real resistance over time
answers.2: fragile — I manage but it's exhausting
answers.3: variable — strong in some areas, weak in others
answers.1: minimal — I'm constantly in survival mode

questions.text: My spiritual margin to absorb setbacks is ...

answers.4: substantial — most setbacks don't destabilize me
answers.5: deep — I have real reserves for hard seasons
answers.3: moderate — I can handle small setbacks
answers.1: nonexistent — any setback is a crisis

questions.text: Victory over specific sins that allows me to mentor others is ...

answers.4: substantial — I have real wins to share
answers.5: accumulated — years of victory I can draw on to help others
answers.3: partial — victory in some areas, not others
answers.1: not there — I'm still losing these battles myself

questions.text: My spiritual immune system when exposed to darkness is ...
questions.principle: Spiritual strength develops through tested exposure

answers.4: strong — most exposure doesn't affect me
answers.5: robust — I can go into dark places without being destabilized
answers.2: fragile — exposure is risky for me
answers.3: moderate — I can handle some exposure

remediation.advice: Spiritual health reserves are built through Layer 4 (discipline) and Layer 5 (skill) applied consistently. If you're always in survival mode, you're either under-investing or over-extending. Establish your foundation before expanding your exposure.

scripture.text: But solid food is for the mature, for those who have their powers of discernment trained by constant practice.
